classes.name: PowerShellAuthorizationMode
classes.description: Enumeration for the supported authorization modes. The modes are "Shared Session" and "Session per User".

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Converts a string to an instance of this class. If String is not possible to be converted an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

classes.name: PowerShellAutorizationMode
classes.description:
Deprecated. Use AuthorizationModeinstead.
Enumeration for the supported authorization modes. The modes are "Shared Session" and "Session per User".

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Converts a string to an instance of this class. If String is not possible to be converted an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

methods.name: getAuthorizationMode
methods.description: Converts a string to an instance of AuthorizationMode class. If String is not possible to be converted an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

classes.name: PowerShellCmdlet
classes.description: Wrapper of a PowerShell cmdlet that resides on the remote Windows machine

classes.name: PowerShellCommand
classes.description: Represents a PowerShell command that can be run on the remote PowerShell host.

methods.name: getCommand
methods.description: Returns the String that this Command object was initialy created.

methods.name: getParams
methods.description: Returns all Parameters as a Map.

methods.name: addParameter
methods.description: Adds a new parameter to the list of params for this PowerShellCommand instance.

classes.name: PowerShellHost
classes.description: Represents a remote host with PowerShell installed on it.

methods.name: closeSession
methods.description: Closes the session with the given sessionId

methods.name: getHostConfig
methods.description: Returns the PowerShellHostConfig instance for this PowerShellHost

methods.name: openSession
methods.description: Opens a new PowerShellSession, which can be used to run PowerShell scrits and cmdlets

methods.name: openSessionAs
methods.description: Opens a new PowerShellSession with provided credentials, which can be used to run PowerShell scrits and cmdlets

methods.name: invokeScript
methods.description: Invokes powershell script without adding it to pipeline.

methods.name: inPipeline
methods.description: Returns the inPipeline flag of the session identified by sessionId

methods.name: startPipeline
methods.description: Starts a pipeline in the context of the session identified by sessionId

methods.name: endPipeline
methods.description: Executes the pipeline associated with the session with id==sessionId and clears the pipeline, removing all commands from it.

methods.name: getSession
methods.description: Returns Session for the given sessionId. Exception is thrown if session does not exist or has been closed.

classes.name: PowerShellHostConfig
classes.description: Encapsulates the configuration for a remote PowerShell host

classes.name: PowerShellInvocationResult
classes.description: Represents the result from an execution fo PowerShell script

methods.name: getErrors
methods.description: Returns list of errors reported by powershell engine during script invocation.

methods.name: getInvocationState
methods.description: Status of execution of the script. Possible values are (Completed, Failed).

methods.name: getHostOutput
methods.description: Returns output of script execution as it appears on the powershell console.

methods.name: getResults
methods.description: Returns list of objects returned by PowerShell engine after successfull invocation.

classes.name: PowerShellPSObject
classes.description: Represents an object on the remote PowerShell machine

methods.name: getProperty
methods.description: Returns value of specific object property. Tha returned value itself can be of primitive type, ArrayList, Hashtable or another PowerShellPSObject

methods.name: getTypes
methods.description: Returns an array containing Types representing all the public classes and interfaces that object implements

methods.name: getToString
methods.description: Returns the object converted to String.

methods.name: getPropertyAsString
methods.description: Returns calue of the provided property converting it to string.

methods.name: getPropertyAsPSObject
methods.description: Returns the value of propName property.

methods.name: getPropertyAsPSObjectList
methods.description: Returns the value of propName property as a list of PowerShellPSObject

methods.name: instanceOf
methods.description: Checks if this instance is of specific type

classes.name: PowerShellRemotePSObject
classes.description: Wrapper for the result from an execution fo PowerShell script

methods.name: getRootObject
methods.description: Returns result of PowerShell script invocation converted in corresponding vCO type. The result can be simple type, ArrayList, Properties or PowerShellPSObject

methods.name: getAsJson
methods.description: Returns the object as String that is JSON formated

methods.name: getXml
methods.description: Returns the object as String that is XML formated

classes.name: PowerShellSession
classes.description: Represents a session to the remote PowerShell machine, that can be used to run scripts and Cmdlets. Also users can benefit from the pipeline concept by demarcating pipeline boundaries with startPipeline() and endPipeline()

methods.name: getSessionId
methods.description: Returns the session id

methods.name: invokeScript
methods.description: Invokes powershell script without adding it to pipeline.

methods.name: invokePipeline
methods.description: Invokes commands currently in pipeline, and remove them from the pipeline.

methods.name: addCommand
methods.description: Adds command to pipeline

methods.name: addCommandFromString
methods.description: Creates command from provided string and adds it to pipeline.

classes.name: PowerShellShellCodePage
classes.description: Enumeration for the supported shell code encodings.

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Converts a string to an instance of this class. If String is not possible to be converted an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

classes.name: PowerShellActionGenerator
classes.description: Generates actions for PowerShell Cmdlets and Scripts

methods.name: createActionForScript
methods.parameters: actionName: string, script: string, moduleName: string, generateWorkflow: boolean, targetFolder: any
methods.description: Generates vCO action for provided PowerShell script.

classes.name: PowerShellHostManager
classes.description: Manager for configuring the PowerShell plug-in hosts

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes the PowerShellHostConfig with the passed in as argument id from the configuration of the plugin.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Creates a PowerShellHost for the passed in as argument PowerShellHostConfig if it doesn't already exist. In case it already exists the PowerShellHost is updated.

methods.name: validatePowerShellHost
methods.description: Checks if the provided hostConfig parameter contains settings that the plugin can use to successfully connect to a remote PowerShell machine. In case the configurations are not valid the method throws appropriate exception.
